description: The Education Loan Scheme by the National Backward Classes Finance and Development Corporation (NBCFDC) provides financial assistance to students from Other Backward Classes (OBCs) to pursue professional or technical education at graduate and higher levels, including vocational courses. The scheme aims to promote educational advancement among OBC students by offering loans at concessional rates to support their academic pursuits.
key_features: Loans provided at concessional interest rates
Covers professional, technical, and vocational courses
Implemented through State Channelising Agencies (SCAs) or Public Sector Banks
Loan repayment period up to 15 years after a moratorium period

benefits.maximum_loan_amount: Up to Rs. 20 Lakhs for studies in India; Up to Rs. 30 Lakhs for studies abroad
benefits.interest_rate: 4% per annum for male students, 3.5% per annum for female students
benefits.moratorium_period: 6 months after course completion or securing a job, whichever is earlier

education_criteria: Students pursuing professional or technical courses at graduate or higher levels
Courses must be recognized by appropriate authorities (e.g., UGC, AICTE)
additional_criteria: Applicant must belong to Other Backward Classes (OBC) as per Central/State Government lists
Annual family income must not exceed Rs. 3 Lakhs
institution_criteria: Recognized institutions in India or abroad approved by relevant regulatory bodies

eligible_courses_delhi: Professional courses like engineering, medical, law, management, etc.
Technical courses approved by AICTE, UGC, or equivalent bodies

steps: Obtain application form from State Channelising Agency (SCA) or Public Sector Bank
Submit completed application with required documents to SCA/Bank
Loan sanction subject to verification and approval by SCA/Bank
application_process.note: Contact SCA or nearest Public Sector Bank for detailed application process

required_documents.note: To prove family income below Rs. 3 Lakhs

special_notes: Loan covers tuition fees, books, equipment, and living expenses
Female students receive a 0.5% interest rate concession
Repayment starts after moratorium period, with flexible terms up to 15 years
